instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message:
HI All,

Macbook air  
Sometimes boots normally and functions 100%.

Other times, fan will spin, with no video or chime.

Board looks good with no obvious signs of corrosion. 

Not a backlight issue.  Will sometimes chime and boot normally. When it does not chime there is no video / backlight.

When it does not boot
- Fan spin 100%
- Draws approx 115 ma on bench power supply

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message:
Reflow SMC first; may need to reball it.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message:
Not reflowed SMC yet. 

I've been working my way through power rails
I have PP1V05 SUS 1.05v
I no NOT have PP1V5 S0 (Zero Volts) 

Is this consistent with SMC issue / PLT Reset issue or is this an upstream problem?

Kind regards,

James

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message: OK I checked all the inputs for <CHIP>U7870</CHIP> and  PP1V5 S0 appeared so maybe never mind. No change in laptop behavior. maybe a misread.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message: So unplugged and reconnected battery and charger. Fan now spinning at 100% but drawing 235ma. these random board issues are the most frustrating.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message:
Ok another update. I was looking over the board again. I found <RESISTOR>R7612</RESISTOR> looked a little off. A bit of corrosion and damage.
I checked voltages on each side as I did board restarted and then restarted with 500ma draw 

This seems to control REFIN of <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. Not sure what REFIN does. Given the intermittent nature of the problem, could this explain things?

Tests as 40k resistance instead of 49k.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook Air - Fan Spin - No VIDEO (intermittent condition)
threads.message:
Power on sequence must be completed, before <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high.
Be sure to get VCORE and <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
